alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Bracken and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Falmouth, Augusta, Brooksville, Higginsport, Powersville, Berlin, Petra, Neave, Woolcutt, Johnsville, Milford, Parina, Browning Corner, Santa Fe, Chatham, Stonewall, Aa Highway at State Route 19 and Mckinneysburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
